answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Generally a high ANA titre indicates an autoimmune disease like SLE, “Sjögren's syndrome (60%), rheumatoid arthritis, autoimmune hepatitis, scleroderma and polymyositis & dermatomyositis (30%), and various non-rheumatological conditions associated with tissue damage. ANA are also directed to the nuclear pore complex in primary biliary cirrhosis. Other conditions with high ANA titre include Addison disease, Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), Hashimoto's, Autoimmune hemolytic anemia, Type I diabetes mellitus, Mixed connective tissue disorder.” Refer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anti-nuclear_antibodyFirst of all these would have to be ruled out one by one. Dehydration, deficiency of calcium and magnesium, irritable bowel can also cause a gag spasm. Multiple sclerosis is also a possibility.It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining. A comprehensive investigation is required keeping all the points in mind. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Hi,I have been in the process of getting a diagnosis for some time now.  I have ANA titer of 1:1280 first time, then 1:640 second time tested. Have extreme fatigue, muscle weekness especially in thighs/hips.  Muscle spasm and tingling.  Am starting to develop slightly slurred speech at times after having an episode of pins and needles in my tongue.  One of my most obviouse symptoms though is a gag spasm. Does not happen while asleep or laying down. Is not from anxiety.  When the spasm is flaring up talking, turning my head, being hungry or nothing at all can trigger a full blown gag reflex.  This will last up to a minute or 3-4 good gag spasms, then usually disappears.  I am seeing an MS doc currently, but he's not sure what's going on, but has a few ideas . I do not have diagnosis of MS at this point.  I did recently find out that my mother's mother died (75 years ago) after a surgery for a medullary spinal tumor. Not sure how genetic this condition is, but it will be getting looked into.  Does any of this sound familiar to anyone.  Has anyone had a spinal tumor with these symptoms especially the gag spasm?Thanks!Jnette
title: gag spasm, spinal tumor?
